title: Help to Buy Isa: time is running out to get your hands on free government cash
text:
Savers have just weeks left to start a Help to Buy Isa which can give up to £3,000 in free money from the Government.

The Help to Buy Isa was launched in December 2015 to aid home-buyers by providing a 25pc Government bonus on cash saved – but the popular deal will be pulled from sale on November 30.

Customers of the Isa can save £1,200 in the first month and £200 per month subsequently, and the 25pc bonus is paid once a house deal is completed on up to £12,000 saved.

The Help to Buy Isa is ending because in 2017 the Government launched a rival deal, the Lifetime Isa (Lisa).

The Lisa is more generous as it allows customers to save £4,000 a year until the age of 50, and pays its 25pc bonus annually....
